data.title: We seem to be leaking AutocompleteViews and Editors
data.body:
In this snapshot, I have only a single tab open in a long-lived session. Yet I'm counting 31 `AutocompleteView` instances and 71 `Editor` instances. Something is fishy.

![screen shot 2013-11-07 at 6 12 51 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1789/1497626/0cb37cd8-4813-11e3-9e09-4b34eea9e29a.png)

data.title: Atom has paths longer than 260 total characters
data.body:
This is making our build huge (~100MB compressed), but more importantly, some files are right past the end of the `MAX_PATH` limit (260 chars), so various parts of Squirrel's build process are failing.

Here's a list of what's currently being included:
https://gist.github.com/paulcbetts/e087d7b5be50a4faf1ee

I've been able to manually trim enough for now that I can keep going, but it's definitely a blocker for an automated build.

data.body:
So core specs are passing but the following packages have issues:
- [x] UIWatcher
- [ ] ProjectFindView

- [ ] Spellcheck

- [ ] TerminalSession

data.title: Markdown: wrapped line + **strong** cursor position bug
data.body:
1. Turn on line wrapping.
2. Write a line that wraps.
3. After the wrap, add some `**strong**` emphasis

Result: the cursor's displayed position is off by about one character.

![ws2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/39902/1491652/5107f112-47b3-11e3-91f3-8214539f51ec.gif)

data.title: Use non-replicated telepath strings
data.body:
![](http://26.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_m2swmcxJqH1r15otbo1_r1_500.gif)

See details about the new mode in atom/telepath-next#1

Closes #1073
Closes #1082

data.title: Storage serialization inside .atom making dotfiles yucky
data.body:
Ok so, I keep .atom in my dotfiles. I keep a dotfiles repo mainly because I have multiple computers. This makes the /storage dir create a mess for me. It makes ~/dotfiles constantly dirty for me, not to mention, I dont really want those things synced across computers.

It'd be nice to see that stuff actually get stored in `~/Library/Application Data/Atom` on OS X. This is where common application data goes, especially device specific things.

A lot of the stuff inside `.atom` would be useful to sync across computers and in dotfiles. This includes app settings, plugins, etc. Environment things. 

It seems to me that state like window size (per project) isn't something anyone would want. Not to mention how often it changes.

I'd love to know if there is consideration being made about `.atom` and people putting it in their dot files. There is currently device specific things in there, as well as things you'd WANT to sync, like settings and plugins. It'd be a shame to just not be able to sync with dotfiles just because of the state that's being saved inside there.

data.title: Every time I search it errors
data.body:
v34.

cmd shift f, enter term, hit <enter>. :boom:

data.title: Add an API to disable selectively disable IME dialog
data.body:
If a user long presses `l` while in vim-mode an IME dialog appears. We want to keep IME support on by default, but it would be nice to allow vim to disable it while in command mode.

Therefore I propose we adding `editor.setImeVisible(boolean)` to the public API so that packages can control it.

Refs atom/atom-shell#47

data.title: Autoscroll on undo/redo
data.body:
The editor does not autoscroll on undo/redo since telepath was introduced.

This is one possible approach to fixing it by marking the last cursor for autoscroll when calling undo/redo on the edit session.

Closes #984

data.title: Undo/redo should scroll change to visible
data.body: If you make a change, scroll so that line is off screen, and undo, the editor should scroll back to the changed line. This is the normal behavior (at least in OS X) and I rely on it heavily as I work.

data.title: Set version strings and icon for the exe on Windows
data.body: This PR implement tasks to set development version and exe icon on Windows. The editor window still doesn't have a icon because of atom-shell bug: https://github.com/atom/atom-shell/issues/123.

data.title: Handle themes with padding on the scroll view
data.body:
In the tomorrow dark theme, the code is jammed up against the gutter. We should be able to use padding on the scroll view and have the editor gracefully handle. 

This: 
![screen shot 2013-11-05 at 6 41 45 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/69169/1479756/0d482d38-468d-11e3-97a7-e9072d5906ff.png)

Not this:
![screen shot 2013-11-05 at 6 42 04 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/69169/1479757/11acc564-468d-11e3-9955-f968515cd52f.png)

Here are some changes that need to happen in order to make this happen.

data.title: Reenable edit session specs
data.body: This brings back some specs that are now working again with telepath@0.21.0

data.title: Pasting pastes twice on windows
data.body:
For some reason when pasting using the keyboard things paste twice.

Also the keybindings in general seem really flaky, sometimes `ctrl-s` will work and sometimes it won't.

data.title: More Menu Fixups on Windows
data.body:
- [x] View should always go after Edit on Windows
- [x] File should always have an Exit item at the bottom that closes the window
- [x] Menus should have access keys - usually you do this by putting an "&" next to the letter you want (like "&Menu")
- [ ] Window menu is a bit....off. Here's a good (if overcomplex) example:
- [x] Atom menu shouldn't exist
  - About => Help menu
  - Version => Help menu
  - Install update => Help menu
  - Preferences => File menu 
  - Hide / Show stuff => /dev/null
  - Quit => File menu

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1396/1477546/3d52847c-465d-11e3-8be4-469f1c811b66.png)

We don't need the tab stuff, but note the "Close all Documents" and the list of Windows with numbers in the front, that's very Windows Zen Nature™

data.title: Atom Menu needs to be Not A Thing on Windows
data.body:
Having the app menu on Windows is a bit weird, we should move these menu items elsewhere:

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1396/1477487/1f5c9774-465c-11e3-8905-6b11f05d416a.png)
- About => Help menu
- Version => Help menu
- Install update => Help menu
- Preferences => File menu 
- Hide / Show stuff => /dev/null
- Quit => File menu

data.title: Open doesn't work sometimes
data.body:
If I use command + shift + o to open a directory, sometimes it doesn't open. Not only that, but if it doesn't work and I then go to the command line and use `atom`, that will not open it either. 

Atom seems to get in a stuck state where it thinks that project/dir is open, but it is not and it just fails to open. If I quit and re-open using `atom` it seems to work again.

data.title: Constantly freezing for a second or two
data.body:
Atom has been constantly freezing for me the past month or so. I am on v32. It happens in both ruby source files and rails erb files. Simple things like navigating with arrow keys and clicking around with mouse or selecting seem to make it happen. Pretty much any interaction I can think of freezes atom for like a second or more. It doesn't happen on every interaction. It does happen more than once per minute.

It is now to the point that it is really hindering me.

data.title: Biscotto doesn't like object key in editor.coffee
data.body:
@gjtorikian can you take a look at https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/editor.coffee#L1723-L1753 and see what's causing biscotto to throw 

```
Cannot parse file /Users/mcolyer/github/atom/src/editor.coffee: Invalid object key
```

(I'd make an issue on biscotto but it's public).

data.title: Global find sometimes puts Atom into unstable state
data.body:
Sometimes when I bring up the project-wide search pane, type in a query, and hit enter, I wind up with an editor that is missing tabs.

Then once in that state, things start to behave weirdly. Closing the remaining tab that’s open makes the next one in the stack of ones I had open become visible (but not the rest) and so forth. The only thing that seems to fix this problem is quiting Atom, restarting it, and rerunning the search then usually works without a problem. I’ve been running into this about once every 30 minutes or so. Any thoughts on what could be going on?

data.title: Global search results open in new tab *and* new pane
data.body:
I personally find it frustrating that the recent switch to global search results opening in a new tab within a new vertically split pane. I only very rarely use split panes, and my main goal when I use global search is just to end up with another tab open in my current pane. When the search results open in a new pane, clicking on a result opens that file in the new pane next to the results, which means that in order to get back to my one-pane setup I now have to drag two tabs back into the original pane.

I actually really liked how the old global search opened results in a drawer up from the bottom. I can handle opening results in a new tab instead, although I think I’d still prefer just a drawer connected to the search fields at the bottom. I can see how the new tab would be helpful so you can close the tab later if/when you need separately from navigating between other files, but going the extra step of creating a new pane for that tab just feels uneccessary and (in my use-case) counterproductive. Is there a good reason for the extra new pane that I’m missing?

data.title: Update soft wrap column on editor resize
data.body:
Use the `overflowchanged` event to detect when the editor's size changes and update the soft wrap column accordingly.

The soft wrap column should now update properly when resizing the window, hiding/showing/resizing the tree view, and when splitting the editor.

data.title: Copy docs into atom io
data.body:
A couple simple changes to build the docs into the atom.io repo:
- check if `../atom.io` exists
- skip building guides as they get imported into the DB and indexed for search

data.title: directories don't include symlink information on windows
data.body: Which causes our symlink spec `spec/directory-spec.coffee:74` to fail.

data.title: Installing commands fails on windows
data.body:
The "install(commandPath, callback)" spec fails and atom fails to install commands when atom is running.

I believe this is related to permission issues.

data.title: Atom slows to a crawl after using for awhile
data.body:
After using Atom for a few hours on any given project it starts to slow down and ultimately becomes unresponsive. Looking at it in Activity Viewer shows 100+ percent usage for the `Atom Renderer` whenever I do anything in Atom, like moving one character  to the right.

![](http://cl.ly/image/2Y1l0Y3m3F3O/content#.png)

Closing and re-opening fixes the issue for a few hours.

Not seeing anything in Developer tools to indicate why this is happening.

data.title: Launching atom.exe immediately closes stdout/stdin
data.body: Currently the executable closes stdout/stdin immediately which makes it difficult to use command line option flags like `-h`. I'm not exactly sure what needs to change to allow this to happen.

data.title: embedded ruby doesn't highlight correctly
data.body:
I'm trying to highlight strings in a theme, but leave interpolated ruby untouched so it can be highlighted by other selectors.

Some interpolated language elements are not highlighting as normal ruby, instead being highlighted as strings. It looks like some elements aren't getting the proper classes, but I admit I'm pretty far out of my depth.

![screen shot 2013-11-01 at 1 02 45 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/680/1456700/ca92be1c-4331-11e3-8002-7bd1416eb38b.png)

I'd expect `def thing(arg1, arg2)` to be highlighted the same as a normal method definition, but it's instead being highlighted as a string. Defining a method inside a string is a terrible idea but I expected it to 'just work' for syntax highlighting.

/cc @kevinsawicki
